title: Mexico’s president hits out at implicit criticism from US
description: 'There's currently more democracy in Mexico than in the United States,' Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador says.

title: Bankman-Fried’s close associate pleads guilty to criminal charges

description: As Putin asked the FSB to bolster security, Moscow said it is open to peace talks, but will not give up annexed regions.

description: The UK's leader has been negotiating with the EU to replace the Northern Ireland Protocol.

title: Mexico approves new Tesla plant in northern Mexico
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador announced the decision on Tuesday following a call with Elon Musk.

title: Cholera outbreak in quake-hit northwestern Syria kills two people
description: Two people have died and 568 non-fatal cases have been reported in the earthquake-hit areas of northwestern Syria.

title: European Parliament to ban TikTok from staff phones: EU official
description: The move comes a day after the US gave federal agencies 30 days to wipe TikTok off all government devices.

title: From California to NY, coast-to-coast storms ravage US
description: Snow, high winds, tornadoes cause damage across US with another massive winter storm brewing.

title: Putin orders tightening of Ukraine border as drones hit Russia
description: One drone crashed 100 km from Moscow on Tuesday, according to the regional governor.

title: Europe leaps towards energy autonomy as sanctions undercut Russia
description: Moscow has waged an energy war against the EU over the past year, but the bloc appears to be holding firm.

title: Israel releases settlers arrested after anti-Palestinian attacks
description: Only eight Jewish settlers were arrested after Sunday's attack on villages near Nablus that left one Palestinian dead.

title: A global happy birthday to hip hop
description: For 50 years, hip hop has given us the soundtrack of rebellion across the world.

title: Russia after a year of sanctions
description: The Russian economy has fallen into a recession, but economic and political instability are not yet on the horizon.

title: Record number of countries enforced internet blackouts in 2022

title: In 2022, the world saw 187 internet shutdowns – 84 by India alone
description: More than half of 84 shutdowns in 2022 recorded in Kashmir as India leads Access Now list for a fifth consecutive year.

description: Digital rights groups say social media giants have restricted, suspended accounts of Palestinian journalists, activists.

title: ‘Everywhere they go, the Rohingya are exploited’
description: Kaamil Ahmed, a British journalist, on his new book about the Rohingya's extraordinary suffering.

description: US secretary of state to meet with counterparts of five Central Asian countries on visits to Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan.

description: Brazilian authorities deploy helicopters over the Amazon jungle in search of clandestine gold mine sites in the Amazon.

title: Can faking volcanic eruptions save the climate? Science is spilt
